page.title: 04PORT OF MENTEITH INCHMAHOME
page.content: The ruins of the Augustinian Priory of Inchmahome stand on an island situated near the north shore of the Lake of Menteith. Since the monument passed into the guardianship of the Secretary of State for Scotland it has been carefully developed and now is one of the most attractive memorials of Medieval monastic life left in Scotland. The plan of the buildings follows the normal arrangement of a medieval religious house, the Kirk being the most important of the buildings. For the building of the Priory the stone was brought from a considerable distance and had to be ferried across the water.It is possible that all the architectural features of the kirk,such as the west doorway and its surrounding piers and their arches were dressed at the quarry.
